attributes.action: Canterbury Council should invest in helping the homeless, not PSPOs.
attributes.background: The Canterbury City Council are introducing new powers in the form of PSPOs in order to make Canterbury free from "anti-social behaviour, such as begging.  In doing this the council are investing money and time that could be used to help the homeless into further criminalising homelessness.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of Canterbury City Council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillor

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here:
https://www.canterbury.gov.uk/your-council/have-your-say/petitions/
